articles.title: About Me
articles.contents:
Contact
Email:
amrose (at) hollandcollege (dot) com
Address:
Waterfront Campus, 98 Water Street, Summerside, PE

Prince of Wales Campus, 300 Kent Street, Charlottetown, PE
Office:
227 WFC

308 PWC
Phone:
902-888-6748
Biography
I’m originally from a small town in Newfoundland, called Harbour Grace. Growing up I loved math and science, so when I had the chance I decided to pursue those subjects in university. For my BSc (Joint Hons) in Applied Math and Physics, I completed research in numerical methods for adaptive mesh generation. This research was conducted under the supervision of Dr. Ronald Haynes. Next, I completed my MSc in Math under the supervision of Dr. Hari Kunduri. This research focused on theoretical black holes and their geometry. My BEd in Intermediate/Secondary Education was completed as I finished my MSc. This included a teaching internship at Prince of Wales Collegiate in St. John’s, NL.



In my spare time I enjoy spending time outside. This includes relaxing beach trips or day long hiking expeditions. Growing up in Newfoundland gives one ample opportunity to explore nature and I’m lucky to continue doing so on beautiful Prince Edward Island. I live in Charlottetown with my wife and our five pets (2 dogs and 3 cats).

Andrew M Rose

                        CV
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Holland College
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            
            Hello | Bonjour | Kwe’
            I’m Andrew Rose and I’m a Learning Manager of Mathematics
            and Physics at Holland College on Prince Edward Island. I
            teach at both the Summerside
            Harbourfront and Charlottetown,
            Prince of Wales Campuses.
            Prior to joining Holland College I worked with Health PEI
            as a Health Information Specialist performing statistical
            analysis and data visualization of data related to the
            province’s healthcare services. As well, I was an Instructor
            at the College
            of the North Atlantic in Carbonear, Newfoundland. There
            I taught post-secondary mathematics within the CAS
            Transfer Program. I hold a BSc (Joint Hons) in Applied
            Math and Physics, an MSc in Math, and a BEd in
            Intermediate/Secondary Education. Check out my CV for a more
            detailed history.
            This site is intended to be a home for course resources,
            professional data projects, and personal projects which may
            be data based or otherwise. Please feel free to contact me
            regarding any errors to the website, or with any questions
            for the published projects!
            
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Andrew M Rose

              Hello | Bonjour | Kwe’
              I’m Andrew Rose and I’m a Learning Manager of
              Mathematics and Physics at Holland College on Prince
              Edward Island. I teach at both the Summerside
              Harbourfront and Charlottetown,
              Prince of Wales Campuses.
              Prior to joining Holland College I worked with Health
              PEI as a Health Information Specialist performing
              statistical analysis and data visualization of data
              related to the province’s healthcare services. As well, I
              was an Instructor at the College
              of the North Atlantic in Carbonear, Newfoundland.
              There I taught post-secondary mathematics within the CAS
              Transfer Program. I hold a BSc (Joint Hons) in Applied
              Math and Physics, an MSc in Math, and a BEd in
              Intermediate/Secondary Education. Check out my CV for a more
              detailed history.
              This site is intended to be a home for course
              resources, professional data projects, and personal
              projects which may be data based or otherwise. Please feel
              free to contact me regarding any errors to the website, or
              with any questions for the published projects!
